As it clear from the post title, I’m going to explain what linear regression is and how it works. I don’t like to read long-long posts because somewhere in the middle I can’t get rid of feeling that the beginning of the post became vague and most of facts were forgotten. So it’s going to be short and painless.

item.title: ASCII Art With Python
item.description: I was always curious about creating cool ASCII “pictures” from actual images and finally decided to figure out how to do it. It’s fairly simple. What we need to do is to resize image to fit in ASCII console (120 columns) keeping it’s original ratio. Then convert it to greyscale and map grey level to ASCII symbol.
